intro: Pseudolysimachion laetum, commonly known as the yellow tansy, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its bright yellow flowers that bloom in the summer. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and streambanks. It has a branched stem with opposite leaves that are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs. Pseudolysimachion laetum is often found in disturbed soils and is considered a weed in some agricultural areas.
